about.title: Professor of Robotics & AI
about.biography: With over 15 years of experience in robotics engineering and artificial intelligence, Dr. Morgan combines academic expertise with real-world application. Previously a lead engineer at SpaceTech Industries, Alex now dedicates time to inspiring the next generation of tech innovators.
about.philosophy: I believe in learning by doing. Theory is important, but nothing compares to the experience of building something with your own hands and watching it come to life.
about.quote: The robots of tomorrow are being imagined by the curious minds of today.
achievements: Founded the Young Innovators Robotics Competition

courses.title: Introduction to Robotics
courses.description: Perfect for beginners, this course covers the fundamentals of robot design, basic electronics, and simple programming concepts.
courses.detailedDescription: This comprehensive introductory workshop is designed to give complete beginners a solid foundation in robotics. You'll start by learning the core principles of robot design and construction, then move on to essential electronics concepts like circuits, sensors, and actuators. Finally, you'll learn how to program your robot using Arduino, giving you the skills to create your very own autonomous robot by the end of the course.
courses.prerequisites: No prior experience needed. All materials and equipment will be provided.
courses.targetAudience: Ideal for high school students, hobbyists, and anyone curious about robotics and programming.

courses.title: Advanced Robot Programming
courses.description: Take your robotics skills to the next level with advanced programming techniques, PID controllers, and complex sensor integration.
courses.detailedDescription: This advanced workshop builds on the foundation of basic robotics knowledge and takes participants into more complex territory. You'll learn sophisticated programming techniques including state machines, PID controllers for precise movement, and how to integrate multiple sensors for advanced autonomous behaviors. By the end of this workshop, you'll be able to create robots that can navigate complex environments and perform precise tasks.
courses.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Arduino programming and simple robotics. Completion of Introduction to Robotics workshop or equivalent experience recommended.
courses.targetAudience: Students, hobbyists and engineering professionals looking to enhance their robotics programming capabilities.
learningOutcomes: Implement PID controllers for precise motor control
Design and code state machines for complex robot behaviors
Integrate and calibrate multiple sensor types
Apply advanced debugging techniques for robotics projects

courses.title: AI for Robotics
courses.description: Explore the cutting-edge intersection of artificial intelligence and robotics, implementing machine learning models on robotic platforms.
courses.detailedDescription: This advanced workshop explores the fascinating intersection of artificial intelligence and robotics. Participants will learn how to implement various machine learning techniques on robotic platforms, including computer vision for object recognition, reinforcement learning for adaptive behaviors, and neural networks for decision making. The workshop culminates in building an intelligent robot capable of learning from its environment and making autonomous decisions based on that learning.
courses.prerequisites: Proficiency in programming (Python) and basic understanding of robotics principles. Some familiarity with AI/ML concepts is helpful but not required.
courses.targetAudience: Computer science students, AI enthusiasts, and robotics professionals looking to integrate machine learning into their projects.

bots.name: Clanky
bots.story: Built by our first-year students, Clanky has won three consecutive maze navigation competitions with its innovative sensor array and adaptive pathfinding algorithm.

bots.name: Whizzy
bots.story: Holding the lab record for the fastest line-following course completion, Whizzy demonstrates the perfect balance of speed and precision control.

bots.name: Grabby
bots.story: With its articulated arm and sensitive pressure sensors, Grabby can pick up objects of various shapes and sizes with remarkable precision.

bots.name: Scout
bots.story: Designed for outdoor environments, Scout can traverse rough terrain and map its surroundings using a combination of LiDAR and computer vision.
